content.description: Slightly overhung. Start with matched hands on lower rail, head up and to the right to mantle top out over jug that juts out.
content.location:
Boulder in a flat meadow underneath Hoodie.

GPS: 34.56, -117.12

content.description: Climb up a small face and then move right past a small corner/roof and up to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts and two bolt anchor. Shares anchor with Bullwinkle.
content.location: On the right side of the hoodie, this is the second route from the right.

content.description: Start under a large under-cling on some slopey side pulls and high feet. Clip the first draw above and slightly left of the cling and continue up, then traverse a tad right after 2nd draw. Stellar and committing moves on steep rock; 2 cruxes - after 1st bolt and another after 4th. A must do Classic of the Hoodie!
content.location: Under the big under-cling in the middle of the Hoodie Formation, to the right of internet superstar and left of mother jugs.

content.description: Start on the left side of the Tea Boulder. Moves up and right at the top. Shares the anchor with Mormon Tea.
content.location: Located on a separate boulder that is 30 feet to the right of the Hoodie Wall. This is the left route on that wall.

content.description:
Big moves that might be a little reachy for some. Bolts 2 and 3 could be the crux.

There is currently a picnic table at the hoodie. This route starts on the boulder that is right of the table.
content.location: Located 10 feet to the left of Rocky. Starts on a boulder that is 15 feet right of the steepest part of wall.

content.description: Hard start with easier climbing up higher. Rock may still be a bit crumbly.
content.protection: Bolts and bolted anchor. Shared anchor with Mr. Tea.
content.location: Right side of the Tea boulder, which is 30 feet right of the main Hoodie wall.

content.description: Clip first bolt and then move up and right on jugs in the crack. Then clip bolt two out left. Crux is passing bolt three with another small crux gaining the anchor.
content.location: This is the farthest route to the left on the main wall.
Located on the far right side of the Hoodie wall.

content.description: Furthest climb to the left. Its on a small formation of its own. Some lie back moves up the corner gain a ledge and then pull past some thin, but solid holds to the anchor.
content.location: All the way to the left on its own formation.
